news.title: Mumbai: Parel residents flag ‘polluting’ SRA building site
news.para: A Parel residents' forum has complained to the MPCB about a Slum Rehabilitation Authority project violating pollution norms. Excavation and activities reportedly continue until 2 am, with a lack of dust control measures like sprinklers or tarpaulin. The MPCB will depute an officer to investigate the matter.

news.title: Accountability is missing in Goa government: HC on illegal constructions
news.para: The Bombay High Court has strongly criticized the Goa government for its lack of accountability regarding illegal constructions. Justices questioned why trade licenses were issued for structures with demolition orders and how commercial operations continued without occupancy certificates, emphasizing the need for preventative measures to ensure public safety.

news.title: CRZ maps & land records forgery: BMC not cooperating with probe, SIT tells HC
news.para: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) informed the Bombay High Court that the BMC is hindering the probe into alleged large-scale tampering of land records and fake city survey maps in Madh island. Despite previous court directives, the BMC's lack of cooperation persists, prompting the High Court to order BMC officials to appear before the SIT.

news.title: Mumbai: Few thousand Dharavi residents need to move to transit homes
news.para: Dharavi redevelopment project will require thousands of residents to move to transit or rental accommodation, contradicting earlier key-to-key rehab promises. This relocation is deemed necessary for the project's smooth transition and to expedite construction. Eviction notices have been issued, with eligible residents offered rent, while others are being moved to previously permanent housing now designated as transit tenements.

news.title: Gujarat govt tells civic bodies, urban development bodies to prepare draft development plans by June 30
news.para: Gujarat is accelerating urban development, aiming to finalize draft development plans and pending town planning schemes by June 30, 2025. This push follows the state's successful bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games and is also timed with upcoming local body elections in early 2026.

news.title: Bright Star Hotels served show-cause notice for violating building norms in Gurugram
news.para: Bright Star Hotels faces serious allegations of violating urban development norms. The district town planner has issued a show-cause notice for allegedly subdividing a hotel-cum-commercial complex into multiple units and selling them without a mandatory license. The hotel could face demolition, sealing, or an FIR if violations are not explained.

news.title: Prestige Group shelves Lutyens' plan, sells bungalow
news.para: Prestige Group has exited a luxury project deal in Delhi's Kasturba Gandhi Marg. Delays in approvals led the Bengaluru-based developer to sell the property. The group acquired the land for approximately 300 crore and sold it for around 450 crore. Prestige Group will now focus on its NCR projects in Ghaziabad, Noida, and Gurgaon.

news.title: Indore eyes slum-free status in five years
news.para: Indore aims to become slum-free in five years, with plans to construct over 16,000 houses under PMAY 2.0 in the next three years. This initiative, costing Rs 2,200 crore, will facilitate the rehabilitation of slum dwellers and clear encroachments hindering development. Detailed project reports for five of the ten selected locations have been submitted.

news.title: Bhopal: 'Housing for all' draws public anger over delays
news.para: Beneficiaries of Bhopal's Housing for All project expressed anger over significant delays in flat possession, with many waiting eight years. Mayor Malti Rai cited RERA approval delays and assured handover by May 2026, acknowledging the financial strain on residents. The project, launched in 2017, has seen repeated protests due to incomplete construction.

news.title: China Vanke seeks 30-trading-day grace period for note due December 15
news.para: China Vanke, navigating through financial waters, has put forth a request to delay a bond payment. The developer is looking to increase the grace period from five days to a generous 30 trading days. Moreover, Vanke has suggested an extension of a year for paying back the principal amount.

news.title: State assembly clears 12 bills, including Karnataka rent amendment bill
news.para: On Tuesday, twelve significant bills were green-lit by the Karnataka Assembly. The Karnataka Rent Act witnessed modifications that decriminalize minor infractions. Further, other legislative measures addressed development authorities and welfare funds, all designed to enhance governance and simplify regulatory frameworks across Karnataka.

news.title: SC grants bail to former DHFL promoters in bank loan scam case
news.para: The Supreme Court has granted bail to former DHFL promoters Kapil and Dheeraj Wadhawan. They were arrested in a multi-crore bank loan scam case. The court observed that prolonged custody without trial violates personal liberty. Bail is the rule, jail is the exception in Indian law.

news.title: ED files chargehseet against Ansal Properties, its promoters
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has leveled money laundering accusations against Ansal Properties and Infrastructure Ltd. and their board of directors. Central to the allegations are claims of environmental law violations, particularly the company's negligence in establishing necessary sewage treatment systems for its developments.

news.title: Kering sells majority stake in New York property in $900 million deal
news.para: Kering, the luxury powerhouse, is making waves by selling a substantial stake in a prime New York property in a deal worth $690 million with Ardian. This strategic sale is part of Kering's plan to manage its debt effectively. Prior to this, the company also divested its Paris real estate holdings.

news.title: Faridabad: Kot residents move HC against new land consolidation plan
news.para: Faridabad villagers have approached the Punjab and Haryana High Court over a revised land consolidation plan, fearing plots will lack road access and farmers will face distress sales. The government withdrew an existing scheme and issued a new one within days, altering consolidation parameters and excluding less land.

news.title: Lucknow: Yazdan Infrastructure's owner among four booked for fraud
news.para: Police have registered a fraud case against Fahad Yazdani, owner of Yazdan Infrastructure, and his associates. They allegedly defrauded two individuals of lakhs of rupees by promising them flats. The victims purchased flats in Alaya Apartments, but the project was later ordered for demolition by the Lucknow Development Authority. The accused are alleged to have extorted crores from multiple people.

news.title: Defaults on the rise in micro loans over property
news.para: According to the report, delinquency levels in the micro-LAP segment rose by 45 basis points (bps) year-on-year to 3.3% as of September 2025. Early delinquencies-measured as loans 90 days or more past due within 12 months on book-increased by 29 bps YoY to 2.2% for originations in the quarter ended September 2024. This is significantly higher than overall LAP early delinquencies of 1.6%.

news.title: Buffer zone dispute leaves Bengaluru development body site owners in limbo
news.para: Thousands of families face an indefinite wait as a forest land claim halts construction in Banashankari 6th Stage. Despite valid site allotments and decades of ownership, residents are unable to build or sell, citing a misinterpretation of forest buffer zone rules. Authorities promise resolution within months, but owners remain financially stranded.

news.title: Bombay HC cancels probate for ₹600 crore Bandra bungalow
news.para: Court finds it was obtained through concealment of facts, false statements about the deceased’s family; emphasised that even unintentional ignorance is no excuse

news.title: Rental farce using dodgy agreements turns out to be elaborate scheme to evade taxes
news.para: ​For several years, sub-tenants across multiple apartment complexes occupied flats under arrangements facilitated by Catena Homes. While rental agreements were shared with housing associations and uploaded on digital platforms such as myGate, the actual relationship was governed by separate lease agreements between Catena Homes and the sub-tenants
